title: Problem 4
text:
Problem 4
 1    def check_number(n):
 2        if n > 0:
 3            return "positive"
 4        elif n < 0:
 5            return "negative"
 6        else:
 7            return "zero"

 8    i = -1
 9    while i <= 1:
10        print(f"{n} is {check_number(n)}")
11        i += 1
Determine the order of execution of the code above on input 11. Use the line numbers provided. Separate the numbers with commas.

 Submit

title: Problem 3
text:
Problem 3
 1    def check_if_even(n):
 2        if n % 2 == 0:
 3            return True
 4        else:
 5            return False

 6    def prompt():
 7        return int(input("Enter a number: "))

 8    val = prompt()
 9    if check_if_even(val):
10      print("The number was even")
11    else:
12      print("The number was odd")
Determine the order of execution of the code above on input 11. Use the line numbers provided. Separate the numbers with commas.

 Submit

title: Problem 1
text:
Problem 1
1  def sum_of_squares(n):
2     if n < 0:
3         return 0
4     return n * (n + 1) * (2 * n + 1) // 6


5  n = int(input("Enter a number: "))
6  print(f"Sum of squares up to {n}: {sum_of_squares(n)}")
7  print("All Done!")
Determine the order of execution of the code above on input 5. Use the line numbers provided.

 1,2,3,4,5,6,7
 5,6,1,2,3,4,7
 5,6,1,2,4,6,7
 5,6,1,2,4,7

Submit

title: Problem 2
text:
Problem 2

 2        if n % 2 == 0:
 3            return True
 4        else:
 5            return False

 6    def prompt():
 7        return int(input("Enter a number: "))

 8    val = prompt()
 9    if check_if_even(val):
10      print("The number was even")
11    else:
12      print("The number was odd")
